channel.title: [317] I followed the makeGlobalObject command carefully, no result...HELP! :)
channel.description:
public void NewObjects() { makeGlobalObject(7369,3350,3251,-2,10);//Carpet
^^ this is what i wrote, and i understand what is what but for some reason no matter how many times i debug it, nothing appears on the server.
i have compiled and restart but still nothing.
i was thinking that maybe there is a command in place on the source that im using what is stopping me from spawing these objects :/
i admit that im new to javascript coding but i have done alot of batch and vbs before so i am easily adaptable to a new code.
can anyone help me pleaseeee :/

item.title: [317] I followed the makeGlobalObject command carefully, no result...HELP! :)
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“4NT, post:7, topic:388921”]thanks to all for time and help, i thought the “x-coords” was the object ID i didnt realise that the first 2 numbers are the coordinates, my bad and thanks again

:)[/quote]

NP, glad my reply helped.

item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Stupit:

Remember to use your TAB key.

It’s not a config file.

I check your coords, they are wrong. I teled and it’s all black, also when i spawned that object it was nothing for me, but that’s probably because i have 508 objects and alot are nulled. But just be sure to double check coords.

item.title: [317] I followed the makeGlobalObject command carefully, no result...HELP! :)
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“4NT, post:3, topic:388921”]adding spaces makes no difference

[code]}
public void NewObjects() {
makeGlobalObject(7369, 3350, 3251, -2, 10); //Carpet
makeGlobalObject(1, 3210, 3423, -2, 10); //Crate
}
public void OBJECTS()
{

}

/WALKING TO OBJECT BEFORE DOING ACTION/[/code]

this is what my code looks like, with what is coded below.

any idea…[/quote]

The first 2 numbers are the X and Y coordinates, the 3rd number is the Object ID, the fourth number (which you have -2) should be Zero unless it is an object that needs to be turned to an angle. Hope that helped…

Read full topic
